inclusion.criterion: Stable epilepsy, either primary generalized or localization-related with partial complex seizures including partial complex seizures with or without secondary generalization, partial simple seizures with a clear motor component with or without secondary generalization, and partial simple seizures with secondary generalization; primary generalized tonic clonic seizures; and absence seizures of > 10 sec duration.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Stable AED doses for at least 30 days
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Exclusively myoclonic seizures or absence seizures of ≤ 10 sec duration; simple partial seizures without motor components or secondary generalization
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Progressive neurological disease including neoplasm, central nerve system degenerative disorders including Alzheimer's disease, other forms of dementia
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: 41 year old man with history of severe intellectual disability, CHF, epilepsy presenting with facial twitching on the right and generalized shaking in at his NH which required 20 mg valium to cease seizure activity. Per outside medical patient was felt to have focal epilepsy with secondary generalization, likely due to anoxic brain injury at birth, and probably related to the atrophic changes seen on MRI, particularly in the left temporal lobe.
